arm_group.description: Umbilical port-site closure with simple suture of the fascia.
Umbilical port-site closure with mesh placement

brief_summary.textblock:
The incidence of port-site hernia in patients with risk factors (obesity, elderly, diabetes
      and lung disorders) can be reduced by the use of a prophylactic mesh in the closure of
      umbilical port site.

clinical_study.brief_title: Prevention of Umbilical Port-site Hernia After Laparoscopic Cholecystectomy Using a Prosthetic Mesh Versus Simple Suture

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Age > 65 years

          -  BMI > 30 Kg/m2

          -  Diabetes mellitus

          -  Lung disease

          -  Elective laparoscopic cholecystectomy

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Umbilical hernia

          -  Previous laparotomy

          -  Conversion to open procedure

          -  Loss during the follow up

intervention.description: Placement of a Omega 3 mesh, fixed to the border of the fascia
The port-site hole is closed with simple suture of the fascia

primary_outcome.description: Comparison of incidence of port-site hernia between patiensts with and without prophylactic mesh placement

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Evaluation of different pain perception in patients with and without prophylactic mesh placement, determined in the postoperative course and at 1, 6 and 12 months after surgery

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Subject), Primary Purpose: Prevention
